summary: Gertrude Belle Elion  was an American biochemist and pharmacologist.
full_text: Gertrude Belle Elion  was an American biochemist and pharmacologist, who shared the 1988 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine with George H. Hitchings and Sir James Black. Working alone as well as with Hitchings and Black, Elion developed a multitude of new drugs, using innovative research methods that would later lead to the development of the AIDS drug AZT.
title: Gertrude B. Elion
